name: Marianne Boring
statement:
**Elected Experience**  
Chair, Vice Chair – Richland Planning Commission and Board of Adjustment  
  
  
**Other Professional Experience**  
Richland City Council - appointed 2020; Project Management, Land Use Planning and Commercial Leasing - 30+ years; Small Business Owner  
  
**Education**  
UC Riverside, Land Use/Environmental Planning Certificate; Riverside Community College, Associates Degree; Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising, Interior Design; Previous Certifications: Project Management, Concrete, Soil  
  
**Community Service**  
Richland Board of Adjustment - 19+ years; Richland Planning Commission - 14+ years; _Charter Member_: 25+KiwaniansWhoCare; _Board Member_: Benton County Mosquito Control; _Volunteer_: Water Follies; 5th Grade Pacific Science Center overnight field trip; _Council Liaison_: Arts Commission, Code Enforcement Board, Benton County Solid Waste  
  
**Statement**  
Leadership means shelving personal agendas, listening to everyone, and representing _all_ of Richland. During my many years of service on the City Planning Commission and Board of Adjustment, I learned to bridge divides to ensure that everyone has a seat at the table, and that’s how I will continue to lead while serving as your representative on the Richland City Council.  
  
I will continue to advocate for ensuring access to open spaces, promoting our vision for healthy and vibrant mixed-use developments for downtown and central Richland, prioritizing fiscal responsibility, proactively focusing on our economic recovery and supporting our community.  
  
I will work to ensure Richland is a resilient, dynamic, and a safe city of belonging with a common-sense mission for the future, that is both responsible and aimed at creating a thriving community.  
  
I am devoted to making our City a better place to live and work and I would be honored to earn your vote!
